Add settings persistence for plot controls across file/variable changes

Features:
- Remember plot settings per plot type (std-site, std-source, etc.)
- Settings persist when changing files or variables
- Settings saved: width, height, scale, difference mode, moving average window
- Per-dataset settings reset: transparency, layer order, dataset MA
- In-memory storage (session-based, not localStorage)
- Auto-apply saved settings on plot generation

Implementation:
- Added plotSettings object to NavigationManager constructor
- Each plot type has separate settings storage
- All control parameters now nullable with fallback to saved settings
- Save logic added to all event handlers:
  * Difference button toggles
  * Width dropdown changes
  * Height dropdown changes
  * Scale dropdown changes (hourly/daily)
  * Moving average window changes
- Settings restored on plot generation if not explicitly provided

User Experience:
- Configure plot once, settings remembered for session
- Switch files/variables without reconfiguring
- Transparency and layer order reset per selection
- Consistent behavior across all plot types

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix daily aggregation scaling and set optimal std plot defaults

Bug Fixes:
- Skip std scaling algorithm in daily aggregation mode
  * Std scaling was designed for hourly DPM (0-60 range)
  * Daily DPM sums can be 200-800+, scaling incorrectly reduced them to 0-50
  * Now skips scaling when aggregationScale === ''daily''
- Fix percentage axis calculation for daily mode
  * Hourly: maxDPM / 60 minutes * 100
  * Daily: maxDPM / 1440 minutes * 100
  * Right-hand axis now shows correct percentages for both modes
- Add missing hasStdFiles and hasNonStdFiles variable declarations

Default Settings for STD Plots:
- Height: 80% (heightScale: 0.8)
- Width: +60% (widthIncrease: 0.6)
- Scale: Daily aggregation (aggregationScale: ''daily'')
- Difference mode: ON (isDifferenceMode: true)
- Moving average: 10-day window (movingAvgWindow: 10)

Implementation:
- Updated plotSettings initialization in NavigationManager constructor
- Both std-site-comparison and std-source-comparison use new defaults
- Settings still persist when users change files/variables
- Users can override defaults via dropdowns

Math Verification:
- Daily DPM now correctly sums all hourly values per day
- Y-axis scales properly to show high daily values (not normalized down)
- Percentage axis reflects correct time period (1440 min vs 60 min)
